Description: Round gold fitting, possibly part of a clasp of a necklace or a bracelet, made of a repoussé sheet of metal, with irregular edge and a hemispherical centre surrounded by a groove; a tiny loop of metal is welded in the centre of the underside, to thread and knot the bead wire.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, From the denuded surface of the site or the neighbourhood ?
Curator's comments: Among the gold "beads and foil ornaments" mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 76 § 73, p. 110, pl. xli, 20.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 76 § 73, p. 110, pl. xli, 20)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.84, p.186, pl.28)
